topics.body: Apparently, a lot of lottery winners end up bankrupt.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a3a063687247aff20000#post_5369a3a063687247aff20000
Ahhh the cruel hand of fate.


And irony.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a3a063687247aff20000#post_5369a3a063687247aff20000
That is because a lot of people are never taught how to control their instincts and thus forth when they get large amounts of money they immediately blow it.  It's like tying someone's hands together and then putting a pint icecream on their head; irrationally trying to immediately move to get the dessert will just wind up with a mess on the floor.

It's why I'm not materialistic; I've experienced first hand what blind desire does.  There is nothing wrong with desire so long as you think about it rationally, but the second you stop thinking with your brain everything makes a mess on the floor.
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a4396368726626cf0000#post_5369a4396368726626cf0000
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a3a063687247aff20000#post_5369a3a063687247aff20000
Ahhh the cruel hand of fate.


And irony.[/bq]
More like stupidity causes stupid decisions.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a3a063687247aff20000#post_5369a3a063687247aff20000
Not that shocking really. Rich people are good at staying rich but ordinary jack offs don't really have any idea what to do with millions and millions of dollars. Not to mention that when your name gets in the paper or whatever for winning it I imagine that you get people wanting a handout or looking to otherwise get their hands on that sweet, sweet money just coming out of the woodwork.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a51b6368721641100000#post_5369a51b6368721641100000
Actually I have to correct something here.  Rich people aren't actually for the most part good at staying rich; rather they're rich because they're rich.  Being rich lets you to become even more rich.  The problem with that is often times this isn't thought through and often times when a recession or depression hits they throw themselves off buildings cause they don't know how to emotionally handle it.  During the great depression hundreds of bankers were throwing themselves off buildings.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5369a5d763687215fd770000#post_5369a5d763687215fd770000
I wasn't starting shit; rather I was bringing up how a common misconception is wrong.

To put it bluntly:  When a recession hits bankers and millionaires have epidemic cases of suicide due to they never could foresee such a thing happening to them.  Someone I used to know by proxy attempted suicide after the housing crash cause he didn't know how to function without the amount of money he had been living on and didn't know how to function now being middle class instead.
